name: HAV-IgM antibody Test
includes: Hepatitis A virus (HAV) is a picornavirus primarily transmitted via the fecal-oral route.

name: HCV Test
includes: Hepatitis C Total Antibody test is a test done to detect, diagnose, and monitor the treatment of a hepatitis C viral infection. There are other tests for HCV but the Total Antibody test is the most routinely used one by doctors. This test is sometimes also called as the Anti HCV test.

name: HEV-IgM antibody Test
includes: Hepatitis E Virus (HEV) Antibodies (IgG, IgM) - Hepatitis E virus (HEV) is the major etiologic agent of enterically transmitted non-A, non-B hepatitis worldwide and has a high case-fatality rate in pregnant women.

name: HBV DNA Test
includes: Hepatitis B Viral load test is a blood test that is used to measure the level of Hepatitis B DNA Viral load in the blood.

name: HCV Genotyping Test
includes: There are at least six types of hepatitis C, which are also called strains or genotypes. Treatment for hepatitis C depends on the genotype, so genotype testing to guide treatment is performed in patients who are diagnosed with an HCV infection. Patients with genotype 1 and type 4 infections may show lower response rates thus requiring higher dosage of treatment, and may benefit from a longer course of therapy

name: HBV-Hepatitis B Genotype & Drug Resistance test by sequencing
HCV Viral Load Test
includes: Qualitative HCV RNA tests can detect the presence of HCV RNA, while quantitative HCV RNA test by PCR measure the amount of HCV RNA. Quantification is an important component of diagnosis and treatment monitoring

includes: The blood and other body fluids have minerals that carry an electric charge. These are called as Electrolytes and perform many important functions in the body. name: Pre-eclampsia screening Test
